formattedAddress: Center Drive, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: Center Drive, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text:
After more than a year of renovations, Central Park's Chess & Checkers House is open again!

The new updates are beautiful, and the brand-new bathrooms are always a welcome addition to the park.

With 24 chess & checkers tables, there is plenty of space to come and play with friends, family, or a date!

The Chess & Checkers House is Central Park's main place to play chess (or checkers). It is conveniently located in the more southern part of the park near The Dairy, Hekscher Playground, and the Carousel.

You can walk to this area from Central Park South (aka 59th Street) in just over 5 minutes; it's only 0.3 miles from the "bottom" of the park.

One of the best parts of this game area is that you can check out game pieces for free!

Games are available to borrow from 10:00 am to 4:30 pm, Wednesday through Saturday.

You cannot make reservations for game pieces or tables; it's first come, first serve.

All you have to do is give your name and phone number to check out some game pieces.

Be sure to come and check out the beautiful renovations of this park section. Let me know what your experience is like in the comments!

originalText.text: Not only is this a free Chess & Checker house you can borrow some pieces for free. The staff that works there are so friendly & you can play with anyone there. It’s so fun playing against people it’s a nice way to spend an afternoon if you like chess or checkers. Sadly it’s only open Wednesday - Saturday

It’s so fun playing against people it’s a nice way to spend an afternoon if you like chess or checkers. Sadly it’s only open Wednesday - Saturday

originalText.text: Renovated place in Central Park. Great for chess games and relaxation.

text.text: Renovated place in Central Park. Great for chess games and relaxation.

originalText.text:
Currently closed for construction (June 2023).

Edit:  changing my review from 1 star to 5 stars.  I have no idea how to rate something that is closed for construction.  My 7-year-old son and I walked half an hour to get there and it was closed, so that feels like 1 star.  On the other hand, according to the Central Park Conservancy web site, they are making some great upgrades (adding bathrooms, wheelchair accessibility, new roof, and more), so that feels like 5 stars.  Importantly, it will still be a chess and checkers house.  Web site says anticipated opening is spring 2023, which is obviously not true, as it is still closed in June 2023.

originalText.text:
Reopened recently and beautifully renovated! Open-air pavilion style area on top of a hill with spacious chess tables with beautiful wooden renovations. Perfect space to play, or just watch and enjoy the weather.

Pieces are available to borrow! But only Wednesday through Saturday 10AM - 4:30PM.

Washrooms and amenities and super clean.
